channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Live: U.S. Senate
channel.desc: Gavel-to-gavel and uninterrupted live coverage of the U.S. Senate from the Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.

channel.title: Public Affairs Events

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: University of Utah professor Eric Hinderaker teaches a class about western settlement before, during and after the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1944 War Department film celebrates the American trucks and tires used to keep the World War II supply chain functioning from Normandy to the front lines.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: American presidents are responsible for the financial health of the nation; a look into how good they are at managing their own wealth; tax attorney Megan Gorman looks at their ledgers to find out.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: Made in cooperation with the U.S. Public Health Service, this 1951 General Electric film shows how water is used in everyday life, the impact of pollution, and how citizens can protect America's water supply.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: The National Park Service and other groups hold a ceremony in Boston marking the 250th anniversary of the Battle of Bunker Hill.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: The Fort Plain Museum & Historical Park in New York hosts authors and historians to discuss the Revolutionary War.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1956 American Can Company film charts the advances in canning and the benefits for food producers and consumers.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: Historians discuss the Civil War at the Gettysburg College Civil War Institute's 2024 annual conference in Gettysburg, Pa.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Lecture on Sacco-Vanzetti & the Supreme Court
channel.desc: Law professor Brad Snyder discusses the controversy surrounding the 1920 Sacco-Vanzetti murder case in Massachusetts.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Michelle McDonald, Coffee Nation
channel.desc: Michelle McDonald, library and museum director at the American Philosophical Society, talks about the role and growing importance of coffee in colonial America through the early nineteenth-century United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: History of the Senate
channel.desc: U.S. Senate Historian Daniel Holt and history professors Joanne Freeman and Joseph Crespino discuss the history of the U.S. Senate. This discussion is part of the American Historical Association's Congressional briefing series.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Alex Marlow, Breaking the Law
channel.desc: Breitbart editor in chief Alex Marlow argues that liberals have weaponized the legal system to attack President Trump and his policies.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Second Lady Vance Hosts NASA Summer Reading Challenge Event
channel.desc: Second lady Usha Vance and astronaut Suni Williams host a summer reading challenge event at NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Sarah Allaback & Monique Parsons, Green Gold - The Avocado
channel.desc: Journalist and avocado farmer Monique Parsons and author Sarah Allaback explore the origins of the avocado and its economic and political impact. Book Passage in Corte Madera, California, hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Dominic Frisby, Daylight Robbery
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference held in 2025 in Palm Springs, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Sarah McLaughlin, Authoritarians in the Academy

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - George Yancey, Beyond Racial Division

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jill Dougherty, My Russia
channel.desc: Former CNN Moscow bureau chief Jill Dougherty talks about her experiences covering Russia and Russian Presidents Gorbachev, Yeltsin, and Putin.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Alex Marlow, Breaking the Law
channel.desc: Breitbart editor in chief Alex Marlow argues that liberals have weaponized the legal system to attack President Trump and his policies.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Second Lady Vance Hosts NASA Summer Reading Challenge Event
channel.desc: Second lady Usha Vance and astronaut Suni Williams host a summer reading challenge event at NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Sarah Allaback & Monique Parsons, Green Gold - The Avocado
channel.desc: Journalist and avocado farmer Monique Parsons and author Sarah Allaback explore the origins of the avocado and its economic and political impact. Book Passage in Corte Madera, California, hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Kate Woodworth, Little Great Island
channel.desc: Author Kate Woodworth discusses her novel on the impact of climate change on the Northeast United States. Politics & Prose in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Andre Perry, Black Power Scorecard
channel.desc: The Brookings Institution's Andre Perry talks about measuring the racial wealth gap & identifies untapped areas of investment that can help to close it.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Rachel Laryea, Black Capitalists
channel.desc: JPMorganChase wealth management researcher Rachel Laryea talks about successful Black businesspeople and their contributions to the U.S. economic system.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Gabe Henry, Enough Is Enuf
channel.desc: Gabe Henry talks about the history of the Simplified Spelling Movement, which wanted to standardize the way English words are spelled. Supporters included Ben Franklin, Mark Twain, and Teddy Roosevelt.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Todd Andrlik, curator and publisher of RagLinen.com, a website for historic newspapers, presents a collection of reportage on the American Revolution from assorted 18th century newspapers.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Hayek Prize Lecture - Johan Norberg, The Capitalist Manifesto
channel.desc: Cato Institute fellow Johan Norberg delivers a lecture on his book The Capitalist Manifesto, the winner of the 2025 Hayek Prize.
